content.description: Nice hand sized crack to a bolted anchor
content.protection: Gear from fingers to hand size
content.location: Scramble down to the right by pinnacle rock.  Turn right and follow the main cliff line for about 50 yards until you see the first obvious crack.

content.description: A fun and cruxy route! Scramble up the juggy slab at the start, pull a few bigger moves between the jugs to get to the third bolt, then work your way through the first crux. Once you make it through to the 4th bolt, prepare yourself for a challenging, but short-lived sequence before riding a juggy lieback to the top.
content.location: Walk down and right (climbers left) at Pinnacle Rock to find a corridor. This route is the left of 3 bolted routes on the gently overhanging face in the corridor. Less than 5 min walk from the parking lot.

content.description: Mostly moderate climbing on bullet-hard stone with one tricky sequence getting to the large slanting hole at about mid-route.
content.location: walk down and right (climbers left) for a little over 100 feet to find this wall with this route. This route is characterized by a slanting hole at about mid height.

content.description: Still a little dirty, once it cleans up a good 5.9 with interesting holds and movement throughout.
content.location: After you exit the tunnel this is the second route on the right.

content.description: Deceivingly tricky moves in the middle
content.location: Second Bolted line  (climbers left) after scrambling down the pinnacle overlook
First Bolted line after scrambling down from pinnacle rock overlook

content.description: Begin on easy moves to a long move into the big jug hole (maybe dynamic for shorter folks).  Finagle your way out of the hold and encounter intersting climbing for the grade up to a unique tree fossil hold beneath the chains.
content.location: Far Left route on Froopy land cliff before you get into the steep cave.

content.description: Sequential yet flowy climbing lead up to a defined and fun crux to exit the roof.  Pull the roof on jugs and finish on 5.9 climbing to the chains.
content.location: First line in the cave after leaving Froopy Land Moderates.

content.description: Another good moderate that needs a little cleaning.  Climb the first few bolts into the kind of tricky dihedral feature, then keep your eyes open for good holds out left as you move towards the top.
content.location: Third line on your right after you exit the tunnel.

content.description: Grade is an estimate-- I have not redpointed yet- rain is my excuse.  Hard fist jamming leads into a hole, then bolts and gear protect the overhung top.
Climb the crack just before the hallway made between a massive pinnacle and the main cliffline. Bolted anchors.
content.protection: Mostly hand size but some fingers and smaller pro is useful.
content.location: Scramble down to the right by pinnacle rock and turn right to follow the main cliffline back towards the stateline overlook.  Walk for about 5 minutes until you get to a hallway where a massive pinnacle is leaning against the main cliffline.  This is the obvious crack right before you go through the hallway.

content.description: The high quality climbing on the top of this route will have you coming back for more! Begin with some jug-bashing as you pass a large flake. Arrive at a crux as the wall starts to overhang slightly, pull a few challenging moves before gaining a jug where you can shake out before crimping your way to the top on some the best crimps in the park!
content.location: Walk down and right (climbers left) at Pinnacle Rock to find a corridor. This route is the middle of 3 routes on the gently overhanging face in the corridor. Less than 5 min walk from the parking lot.

climbs.name: The Bishop
climbs.fa: Daniel Wilkes, Amy Fegely, Nicole Meyer

content.description: 6 bolts to a bolted anchor.  Climbs a thin crack feature in the middle of the route.
content.location: Scramble down to the right next to pinnacle rock.  Turn right and walk for about 5 minutes through a hallway created by a massive pillar leaning on the main cliffline.  This is the first sport route on the right after going through the hallway.
